north-sikkim-tour.title: Enchanting North Sikkim: A 5N | 6D Adventure
north-sikkim-tour.description: Nestled in the northeastern part of India, Sikkim is a picturesque state renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty, vibrant culture, and spiritual heritage.
north-sikkim-tour.longDescription: Sharing its borders with Bhutan, Nepal, and Tibet, this landlocked state is crowned by the majestic Mt. Kanchenjunga, the third-highest peak in the world. Sikkim's serene landscapes, dense forests, and rich biodiversity make it a haven for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers alike. Historically, Sikkim was an independent kingdom ruled by the Namgyal dynasty until its merger with India in 1975. The state is deeply influenced by Tibetan Buddhism, as reflected in its many monasteries, stupas, and prayer flags. The legacy of Guru Padmasambhava, also known as Guru Rinpoche, is deeply revered, with several sites dedicated to this great spiritual figure. Today, Sikkim is celebrated not only for its pristine environment but also for its harmonious blend of traditional and modern lifestyles. It's warm hospitality and unique cultural identity make it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking a memorable Himalayan experience.
includes: All transfers and sightseeing by Personalized AC Car
All Toll tax, parking fees & driver allowances
excludes: Entrance fees to monuments and museum
Other meals not mentioned laundry, telephone calls, and incidentals.
Any personal expenses. Room service and special orders. Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.
Any expense arising due to unforeseen circumstances is not included.

itineraryDays.title: Arrival at NJP/IXB and Transfer to Gangtok
activities: Meet and greet by representatives of Bademiyan Tours and Holidays Operators at NJP Railway Station, Bagdogra Airport, or Siliguri Bus Stand.
En route, enjoy scenic views of the Teesta River and lush greenery.
Check-in at your hotel. Rest of the day is free for leisure and exploring MG Marg.

itineraryDays.title: Gangtok to Lachen Transfer
activities: After breakfast, embark on a journey to Lachen (Approx. 120 km | 6 hrs).
En route, visit the Seven Sisters Waterfalls and Singhik View Point.
Experience the serenity of the confluence of Lachen Chu and Lachung Chu rivers at Chungthang.
Arrive in Lachen and check in at your hotel.

itineraryDays.title: Lachen to Gurudongmar Lake and Transfer to Lachung
activities: Early morning, start your journey to the majestic Gurudongmar Lake (Approx. 67 km | 3.5 hrs).
Situated at an altitude of 17,800 ft, this sacred lake is one of the highest in the world.
Post breakfast, proceed to Lachung (Approx. 50 km | 2 hrs).
Check-in at your hotel and enjoy the evening at leisure.

itineraryDays.title: Lachung to Yumthang Valley and Transfer to Gangtok
activities: After breakfast, visit Yumthang Valley (Approx. 25 km | 1.5 hrs), also known as the 'Valley of Flowers.'
Optional visit to Zero Point (subject to road and weather conditions).
Drive back to Gangtok (Approx. 120 km | 6 hrs).
Check-in at your hotel for an overnight stay.

itineraryDays.title: Gangtok Local Sightseeing
activities: After breakfast, explore the popular attractions of Gangtok:
Tsomgo Lake: A glacial lake at an altitude of 12,400 ft (Approx. 40 km | 1.5 hrs).
Baba Harbhajan Singh Mandir: A shrine built in honor of an Indian army soldier.
MG Marg: Spend leisure time shopping and savoring local delicacies.
Return to the hotel for an overnight stay in Gangtok.

itineraryDays.title: Gangtok to NJP/IXB Drop
activities: After breakfast, transfer to NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport (Approx. 125 km | 4.5 hrs).
End of the tour with cherished memories of North Sikkim.

pelling-namchi-gangtok-tour.title: Pelling, Namchi & Gangtok Tour

pelling-namchi-gangtok-tour.longDescription: Nestled in the northeastern part of India, Sikkim is a picturesque state renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty, vibrant culture, and spiritual heritage. Sharing its borders with Bhutan, Nepal, and Tibet, this landlocked state is crowned by the majestic Mt. Kanchenjunga, the third-highest peak in the world. Sikkim's serene landscapes, dense forests, and rich biodiversity make it a haven for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers alike. Historically, Sikkim was an independent kingdom ruled by the Namgyal dynasty until its merger with India in 1975. The state is deeply influenced by Tibetan Buddhism, as reflected in its many monasteries, stupas, and prayer flags. The legacy of Guru Padmasambhava, also known as Guru Rinpoche, is deeply revered, with several sites dedicated to this great spiritual figure. Today, Sikkim is celebrated not only for its pristine environment but also for its harmonious blend of traditional and modern lifestyles. Its warm hospitality and unique cultural identity make it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking a memorable Himalayan experience.

namchi-gangtok-north-sikkim-tour.title: Namchi, Gangtok & North Sikkim Tour
namchi-gangtok-north-sikkim-tour.location: Namchi, Gangtok, Lachen, Lachung, North Sikkim, India
namchi-gangtok-north-sikkim-tour.description: Explore Sikkim’s spiritual and natural wonders—from the serene Char Dham to the spectacular Gurudongmar Lake and Yumthang Valley.
namchi-gangtok-north-sikkim-tour.longDescription: Nestled in the northeastern part of India, Sikkim is a picturesque state renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty, vibrant culture, and spiritual heritage. Sharing its borders with Bhutan, Nepal, and Tibet, this landlocked state is crowned by the majestic Mt. Kanchenjunga, the third-highest peak in the world. Sikkim's serene landscapes, dense forests, and rich biodiversity make it a haven for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers alike. Historically, Sikkim was an independent kingdom ruled by the Namgyal dynasty until its merger with India in 1975. The state is deeply influenced by Tibetan Buddhism, as reflected in its many monasteries, stupas, and prayer flags. The legacy of Guru Padmasambhava, also known as Guru Rinpoche, is deeply revered, with several sites dedicated to this great spiritual figure. Today, Sikkim is celebrated not only for its pristine environment but also for its harmonious blend of traditional and modern lifestyles. Its warm hospitality and unique cultural identity make it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking a memorable Himalayan experience.
